July 17, 1956
Mr* James P. Baxter, President
Williams College
Williamstown, Massachusetts
Dear President Baxter*
We are very pleased to see that your institution has been granted a
CP for a new educational station. The forces of educational broadcasting
are growing stronger every day, and, as the association of educational
stations in the United States, we feel that you will be interested in
learning something about our organization and the services it provides
to members. Incidentally, better than 90% of all educational radio and
television stations in the United States belong to the NAitS*
X am enclosing some material which will give you more details about th8
Association, and under separate cover am sending samples of the reports,
surveys and other services we regularly make available to member stations*
Annual dues in the Association, including a subscription to our monthly
Newsletter and the above mentioned materials, are based on rated transÂ¬
mitter power, as followsi
Class A - 5 lew and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - U.9 lew - 25#00
Class C - Less than 1 kw- 15*00
In addition to the above, member stations enjoy the benefits of our
Placement Service, legal counsel, help in meeting day-to-day problems,
the opportunity to meet, in seminars, conferences and conventions, with
other educational broadcasters to consider mutual problems, and, for the
payment of an aduitional assessment fee, the use of our tape network*
The NAEE Network, which distributes over 1*00 hours of programming, via
tape recording, per year, is open only to members of the Association*
Through the Network you have an opportunity to broadcast some of the best
educational programs from all over the country as well as a chance to
have some of your better programs receive wider distribution. In addition,
being able to rely on the Network for eight or more hours of programming
per week permits your staff to spend more time on the development of
outstanding programs.
